Tim was very sad that his toy car could not be fixed. He played with it again and again, but it was not the same. The wrap came off and the broken pieces fell apart. Tim's mom said they could not fix the broken car anymore. Tim cried and had to say goodbye to his favorite toy car.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He had a big bag with him. Inside the bag were his toys, like a ball and a teddy bear. Tim was very happy to play with his toys.
At the park, it was icy and cold. Tim saw a big slide. He wanted to go down the slide. He put his bag down and climbed up to the top of the slide. Then, he sat down and got ready to slide.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. While they were walking, Tim found a prune on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Look, mom, a prune!" he said. His mom said, "That's a nice prune, Tim. But we should test it to see if it is good to eat."

to the ground and it was broken. The girl was so sad and began to cry. 
Her parents saw what happened and told the girl not to worry. They said they would buy her a new box and she could store her treasures inside it. 
After a few weeks, the girl's parents returned with a new box and the girl was very happy. She was able to store all her treasures inside it and use it to play with every day.

play with. One day, the barrel became broken, and Bobo was very sad.
Bobo's friend, Toto the turtle, saw that Bobo was sad. Toto wanted to help fix the broken barrel. Toto had an idea! He would borrow some tape from his friend Dodo the duck to fix the barrel.
Toto went to Dodo's house and asked, "Can I borrow some tape to fix Bobo's broken barrel?" Dodo said, "Yes, of course!" Toto took the tape and went back to Bobo's house. Together, they fixed the broken barrel.

"Let's pretend they are ropes!" Mia said. She took a red cable and made it loop. "Look, I can swing from the ceiling!"

's too loud!" Lily tried to stop, but she couldn't. The microphone was broken. It kept making noise.
Lily felt scared and sad. She dropped the microphone and ran away. She cried all the way home. She wished she never sang for her friends. She wished she never had a microphone. She wished her dad was there to hug her. But he wasn't. He was far away, working. Lily felt alone and sorry. She had a bad day.

Once upon a time, there was a chicken called Bob. Bob was so very filthy, because he liked to roll around in the mud. Every morning, he would hop and play in the mud.
One day, spring arrived and Bob wanted to keep on playing in the mud. But it was too hot to stay in the sun, so Bob went to look for a shady place to play

the ground and it was broken. Tim felt sad for her and wanted to help. He walked over to the girl and said, "Don't cry, you can have my ice cream cone." The girl stopped crying and smiled.
Tim's mom saw what happened and was very proud of him. She hugged Tim and said, "I'm so proud of you for sharing your ice cream with the little girl. That was very kind." Tim felt happy that he could help someone else.
The moral of the story is to always be kind and share with others. When you help someone, it can make both of you feel happy.

. He wanted to watch it, but as he got closer, he saw that it was broken. He was really sad and didn't know what to do.
His mom came over and saw him standing there. She told him not to worry and that she would fix the picture. She said that he should go and play while she worked on the picture.
Jimmy went to play with his friends and when he came back, the picture was ready again. He was so happy, and he watched the picture for a long time. He was so glad he didn't have to miss out on it.

. Tom and Lily were sad. They asked their mom why the fountain was broken. Their mom said that the fountain needed water and power to work, and that sometimes they ran out. She said that the people who took care of the park would provide water and power soon, and then the fountain would work again.
Tom and Lily did not understand what water and power were, but they trusted their mom. They decided to play with other things in the park while they waited for the fountain to come back. They ran, swung, slid and climbed. They had fun, but they still missed the fountain. They kept looking at it,

Once there was a hoptopus. He was always bouncing around. One day he saw a tight rope in the park. He hopped to it and stopped. He looked up and down the rope and he saw it was really tight. So he grabbed on with his tentacles and started hopping up and down the rope. He was so proud of himself. He hopped all the way to the top. Then he hopped all the way back down again. , he realized it was broken. He felt so sad that something so cool was not working. 
Joe's dad noticed his sadness, so he put his arm around Joe's shoulders and told him that even though the elevator was broken, it still had value. Joe looked up at his dad and asked what he meant. His dad explained that the elevator was still valuable because it played an important role in the apartment building. It helps people go from one place to another quickly and easily.
